[119]Please. 
[120]You promised. 
[121]Claire, she's been a huge part of your life for seventeen years.  If you weren't thrown off balance by this, then something would be wrong. 
[122]I never said... 
[123]Are you lonely? 
[124]What are you doing out here? 
[125]This is the Feur thing? 
[126]How do you know this? 
[127]Who did? 
[128]How did you-- 
[129]Are you angry at me? 
[130]Maybe you resent how busy I've been. 
[131]You know what I've got at stake with this paper.  You know that.  I can't help but think that you're doing this now to hurt me, or to sabotage me somehow. 
[132]Ever since the accident I've been worried that you'd been unhappy, or... 
[133]But then you've been so much better... 
[134]Sweetheart-- 
[135]You're overreacting. 
[136]Keep your voice down. 
[137]Claire, please... 
[138]Claire, please... 
[139]I'm sorry... 
[140]...I'm pulling up, Yuri.  I'll see you for dinner. Sure you won't stay? 
[141]Really big bed. 
[142]Do I have everything? 
[143]Call ya later. 
[144]What? 
[145]You know I am. 
[146]You were lost in the music...eyes closed...your chest heaving... 
[147]We walked all night... 
[148]...that you were everything I'd ever dreamed of. 
[149]You remember my wife, Claire. 
[150]Uh-huh. 
[151]You don't remember? 
[152]You dropped a glass. 
[153]A cheap wine glass from the caterers.  You started crying.  I tried to comfort you... 
[154]You shoved me away and ran out to the patio.  I took you home. 
[155]It was maybe a week after the accident. We were moving.  It was a hard time. 
[156]Sweetheart, it was over a year ago. 
[157]Nothing.  Nothing at all.  It's been a hard year.  But you're better now.  And things are really looking up for us.  So let's try to enjoy that. Please? 
[158]Is this that girl from last year? 
[159]I may have seen her on campus. 
[160]No. I'm afraid to ask what this is about. 
[161]The... 
[162]Stop... 
[163]...Please stop... 
[164]
[165]Claire, I've tried to be there.  I know you're going through something that I can't understand...but it's enough. 
[166]Do you want to go see someone?  Together? Should we call Dr. Drayton? 
[167]Well then what?  Claire, what?  Tell me what I can do. 
[168]Hello...Anybody home?! 
[169]Mrs. Spencer. 
[170]I take it your not mad at me. 
[171]Okay... 
[172]What's gotten into you? 
[173]Ow! 
[174]It's too rough. 
[175]I don't like this, this... 
[176]Who? 
[177]
[178]What the hell are you doing?! 
[179]What? 
[180]Claire-- 
[181]Oh God... 
[182]It was last year.  We were having troubles. 
[183]That's not what I'm sayi-- 
[184]Claire, please don't... 
[185]I never asked you to quit! 
[186]THAT'S NOT TRUE!  You wanted to quit!  And then when you did, you hated me for it... so you gave it all to her. 
[187]To Caitlin!! 
[188]And then out of nowhere, some bright young woman found me attractive... 
[189]...would do anything just to be around me.  And I slipped.  God help me, I slipped. 
[190]I tried to break it off! 
[191]Claire... 
[192]
[193]Yes. 
[194]She was damaged and unstable.  The more I tried to distance myself, the more desperate she became.  Finally, she showed up at the new house... 
[195]She was out of control.  She said she was going to kill herself...or you.  I never thought she'd go through with any of it, but then she was gone... 
[196]We don't know that for sure. 
[197]Oh God, what have I done?  How could I have let this into our lives? 
[198]Thanks. 
[199]That won't be necessary. 
[200]Not unless there's a miracle drug for clumsiness. 
[201]Are you okay? 
[202]We have to get out of here. 
[203]Can't you see, she's trying to kill us. 
[204]What? 
[205]How can you be sure? 
[206]Claire... 
[207]I know it's going to take awhile before things are back...until they're better than before.  But you've given us a chance to make a fresh start.  And I'm going to spend the rest of my life making you glad that you did. 
[208]Last sail of the year. 
[209]Incredible.  We should take a drive before they're gone.  Spend the night at some cozy little bed and breakfast. 
[210]Yep.  There's some great places nearby. 
[211]What? 
[212]Huh. 
[213]Don't think so. 
[214]Whatever you'd like. 
[215]What's that for? 
[216]I'm cooking you dinner. 
[217]I know. 
[218]Okay.  Don't...you don't understand what this is. 
[219]I did NOT!  I did not kill anyone.  Jesus. Claire, listen to me.  I walked in and she was lying there dead.  I swear to you.  On my life!  She took pills and she killed herself in our house to destroy me!  To destroy us!  If I hadn't stopped by here before school, the painters would have-- 
[220]IT'S TRUE.  That's...you have to believe me!  Oh God, I'm telling you the truth! I did what I had to, Claire.  She was gone.  There was nothing I could do for her.  I did...I put her in the lake.  I rolled the car in...and I watched it sink. And I've lived with that image ever since. I couldn't just stand there while everything-- my career, us, everything, just washed away.  Don't you see, Claire?  She's doing this!  This is exactly what she wants you to think! 
[221]Fine.  I can't live with it anymore. 
[222]This is Dr. Norman Spencer.  No, it's not an emergency. 
[223]I have some information about a missing girl, Madison Frank...Yes.  Could you send an officer?  Fifteen Willoughby, about a mile before the bridge...Thank you. 
[224]You did the right thing. I'm going to get cleaned up. 
[225]God, how did we come to this? 
[226]The ghost stuff, that was impressive. 
[227]I figure you saw her that day in the house and just gradually intuited the whole damn thing.  That would be pretty astonishing.  A passive-aggressive masterpiece. 
[228]Wasn't until the shower that I realized you actually believed it.  Nearly froze to death waiting for you.  Thought the circuit breaker would kick back over and I'd be toast. 
[229]The crazy thing is...I have never for one moment stopped loving you. 
[230]Don't worry about Caitlin.  I'm sure in some tragic way this'll bring us closer together. 
[231]Hey, it's Norman.  Listen, we had a huge blowout, so I'm going down to sleep at the lab.  I guess you're out, but... maybe...if you wouldn't mind stopping by to check on her in the morning? 
[232]It's just...Jody, it's bad.  I've never seen her like this... I don't really know what to do anymore. 
[233]If anything ever happened to her, I'd... Anyway, thanks. 
[234]I'm so sorry. 
[235]Shhhh. 
[236]What? 
[237]That's a little much, don't you think? 
[238]Oops.  Can't have that.
dialogues.JODY:
[1]How you holding up? 
[2]You are? 
[3]Cause...your...only daughter just went away to school...who you were incredibly close with aaand I'd be tripping... 
[4]Well good.  So you're human. 
[5]Wow.  Got here just in time. I brought you this. 
[6]Kambucha mushroom tea... 
[7]It soothes heart-ache and promotes psychic wellness.  Sela suggested I bring-- 
[8]She's not a psychic.  Just a very enlightened spirit. 
[9]So you'll have some later. Notice anything...different? 
[10]Yep. 
[11]Beautiful thing, alimony.  Lose a husband, get a car.  Think it'll help me pick up dudes? 
[12]Listen, I've gotta run.  I just thought I'd stop by and see if you want to take the boat out, say Thursday morning? 
[13]See you then. 
[14]What do you mean she's gone? 
[15]What are you saying? 
[16]You think he killed her? 
[17]Know what I think? 
[18]Seance. 
[19]Telling you... 
[20]Just bought this beautiful antique Ouija. 
[21]Hey, look. 
[22]So pretty. 
[23]What? 
[24]I don't... 
[25]No, you're not. But a presence in your house is not something to be taken lightly. 
[26]Sit down here. 
[27]Isn't this where you saw her? 
[28]Then this is where she'll be. 
[29]Place your fingers on the planchette. 
[30]This. 
[31]We wish to commune with the spirit of Mrs. Feur. What's her first name? 
[32]I call forth the entity that is haunting this house. 
[33]Mrs. Feur? 
[34]Shhh. 
[35]Reveal yourself to us. 
[36]Who...who are you? 
[37]
[38]Mef?  What's Mef? 
[39]Shit... 
[40]Did you see that? 
[41]Oh God... 
[42]I have to go. 
[43]Claire, this is...this is... 
[44]Are you okay? 
[45]I'm sorry for leaving, but I mean, Jesus, Claire... 
[46]I mess around with this stuff, but I never thought anything would happen. 
[47]Does Norman know? 
[48]What? 
[49]Then what was it? 
[50]Something was there.  You saw it. 
[51]Yes.  Now I talked to Sela and there's a guy, this Pakistani guy down in Hartford... 
[52]And he's the real thing.  Specializes in cases like this, like yours. 
[53]But Claire-- 
[54]Okay.  Okay. 
[55]I was down in Adamant... 
[56]Artsy little village down seven.  There's a guy there who sells my work.  I had just dropped off some paintings and as I got in my car...I saw Norman sitting at this little cafe. 
[57]I started to walk over...but he wasn't alone.  A blond.  I only caught a glimpse. She was young. I should have said something right away. But I didn't. 
[58]Partly because I didn't want to hurt you...but partly...partly because I was relieved. 
[59]I had just been left by Richard.  I was bitter and miserable and for some fucked up reason, it made me feel better that your life wasn't as perfect as it seemed. 
[60]By the time I finally got up the nerve to tell you, Stan called from the hospital and it was too late. 
[61]Alone?  On a two lane road?  With a ton of Valium in your system? 
[62]I got there first.  Stan covered up the pills and I had it out with Norman.  He seemed desperate not to lose you.  He promised to handle it.  And we all let it drop away. 
[63]I'm a terrible friend. 
[64]What are you going to do? 
[65]If she was dangerous before-- 
[66]You don't know that. If it's your belief that gives her form, then you've got to shut her out.  Somehow you have to break the connection. 
[67]I know. 
[68]We need help.  Please let me call the medium. 
[69]Alight, alright.  Stay calm.  You opened this door.  There's got to be a way that you can close it. 
[70]I have an idea.  But, I mean, I'm just making this up... 
[71]Did he say that? 
[72]What if he was?  Do you think he wanted to bring that up again just when you're trying to make a new start? 
[73]He's trying to put it behind him, Claire. You should too. 
[74]You've got a beautiful life.  And even with this, it's always been clear that he loves you. I've come to think that's all that really matters. 
[75]Trust me, Claire.  You hear something... change the subject.  You find something... get rid of it, throw it in the lake. You know what happened.  The rest is only details.  And no one's ever glad they got a hold of those.  If you want to put this back together...just let it go.
dialogues.CAITLIN:
[1]I'm totally ready. 
[2]Mother... 
[3]You're such a morning person. 
[4]Blueberries! 
[5]Hey. 
[6]It's only two hours away. 
[7]I'll come back all the time. 
[8]I'm just saying, you're going to be fine. 
[9]Mother... 
[10]Mom. 
[11]I have'ta go. 
[12]I'll call you. 
[13]Bye. 
[14]Mom, I'm sorry.  I wanted to tell you. But it never felt right. 
[15]I didn't want to bring up memories.  I didn't want to do anything that might make you regret your choices. 
[16]Besides, Dad would have freaked. 
[17]I think playing in a band called "Bitch" might put a dent in the whole "perfect family" thing. 
[18]Yes it is.  Can we please not do that? Please?  Cause it is. 
[19]I know he does. 
[20]Are you mad at me? 
[21]So much. 
[22]What do you mean? 
[23]A ghost? 
[24]No.  But once I heard... 
[25]Someone crying.  A girl. I thought I was crazy.
dialogues.ELENA:
[1]Ohmigod... 
[2]This is... 
[3]We had this Finnish conductor, Aki, Laki, something.  He had these ridiculous bangs. And he'd sweep them off with his baton every minute or so, and it drove us insane, remember? 
[4]Anyway, Claire slept with him... 
[5]...just so she could cut them off. 
[6]I came in from my room... 
[7]And there's this brilliant conductor in purple briefs with no bangs cursing his ass off in Finnish. 
[8]You should have heard her play. 
[9]We both auditioned for the Philharmonic. One cello position open. 
[10]And I kicked ass.  My best stuff.  Then I stood in the hallway and listened to her audition...and I cried. 
[11]I'm not.  Couldn't pick up my cello for weeks. 
[12]She got it. Turned it down.
dialogues.VOICE:
[1]Here I am. 
[2]Claire... 
[3]Mom? 
[4]Guess I'm not much of a medium. 
[5]...she was practically a townie.  Grew up in Bradford. 
[6]Nah.  She was a live wire.  Had this old Mustang Fastback.  It's gone too.  Most of her friends think she's tooling around Mexico somewhere.  Police downgraded her to a runaway. 
[7]Directory assistance...
